text: conspiracy theories have a long history
certainly in American literature going
back even to the years after the
Revolution when there was an atmosphere
of political paranoia and suspicion
which I think has never gone away in
American culture but certainly reflowed
during the Cold War the film that I
think is maybe the first great
conspiracy movie certainly of the 1960s
is John Frankenheimer's The Manchurian
Candidate which is not only about a
conspiracy but the very structure of the
movie where you don't always know from
scene to scene what you're looking at
how it adds up what it means I think
that's a movie that that kind of
inaugurates a sort of paranoid style of
filmmaking where the reality that's
being presented to you on the screen
isn't just a story that's being told to
you but something that you have to
decode something that you have to figure
out something that you maybe can't trust
so how is it possible for as well to a

understate matters did not accept the
